title: FOIA Banta United States Army Vietnam War

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Official Military Personnel File (OMPF) for subject listed below
Name of Veteran: Irvin Banta
Branch: United States Army
birth date: April 16, 1951
Dates of Service: 1970 to 1991

Please provide the following military service information:
1. dates of service, dates of ranks, stations, list of awards, decorations, Badges, assignments, Vietnam War service
2. Section VII CURRENT AND PREVIOUS ASSIGNMENTS form
3. copy of Bronze Star Medal award citation
4. Military Education/ training courses
5. copy of Defense Meritorious Service Medal award citation
6. request copy of Army commendation award citations
7 request copy of Joint Meritorious Unit Award citation
8. Section V MISCELLANEOUS Form
9. Date of Discharge
10: Overseas service dates
I request copies of paperwork in the file showing this information.
military career to include the Bronze Star with Valor, Army Commendation Medal with Valor, Joint Meritorious Unit Award, Republic of Vietnam Gallantry Cross Unit Citation Ribbon, Vietnam Service Medal. 

First name: Irvin
Last name: Banta
DOB - 4/16/1951

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Eric Bradley

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

Sincerely,

Scott Conway

title: Mark Anthony Conditt and Austin Bombing (Texas Department of Public Safety)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

In 2018 a series of bombings were perpetuated by Mark Anthony Conditt. The investigation involved the FBI, Austin Police Department, and the Texas Department of Public Safety. I am requesting 

- Audio or direct transcription of the 25 minute video recording my Mark Anthony Conditt as referenced by Governor Greg Abbot and former Austin Police chief Brian Manley -
 https://web.archive.org/web/20180323120234/https://www.statesman.com/news/breaking-austin-bombing-suspect-dies-police-close-official-says/KZmUAGvKlNazDr31EzeUzI/
https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2018/03/22/austin-bomber-challenged-young-man-or-terrorist/

- Any documents relating to the investigation, identification, or pursuit of Mark Anthony Conditt

- Any documents regarding a follow up investigation on any groups or associates of Mark Anthony Conditt. 

I ask that the fee be waived as this information is within the public interest and many documents were widely commented on despite them not being available to the public (namely the 25 minute recording) release and access of this information is crucial to fair and accurate reporting on this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nate Zaffiro

title: 1963 FDA Raid on Founding Church of Scientology (Department of Justice, United States Marshals)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all documents in your possession pertaining to the investigation or execution of the 1963 Raid on the Founding Church of Scientology 

- Any and all documents in your possession regarding the Founding Church of Scientology



This event is public knowledge and of public knowledge. Listed below are publications, legal rulings, or academic works who reference the raid.

Food and Drug Administration, FDA Church of Scientology/E-Meter Files (n.d.), accessed February 4, 2026, http://archive.org/details/FDAScientology.

“Interview with William W. Goodrich--Part 2,” accessed February 6, 2026, https://web.archive.org/web/20040219095225/ttp://www.fda.gov/oc/history/oralhistories/goodrich/part2.html#scientology.

Scientology and the FDA:  A Look Back, A Modern Analysis, And A New Approach, n.d.

Paul Horwitz, “Scientology in Court: A Comparative Analysis and Some Thoughts on Selected Issues in Law and Religion,” DePaul L. Rev. 47 (January 1997): 85.

Stuart A. Wright and Susan J. Palmer, “The Church of Scientology,” in Storming Zion: Government Raids on Religious Communities, ed. Stuart A. Wright and Susan J. Palmer (Oxford University Press, 2016), https://doi.org/10.1093/acprof:oso/9780195398892.003.0008.

Hubbard Dianetics Research Foundation Charles Leonard, AMA Files Given To FDA Exhibit 9 Challenge From L. Ron Hubbard To Psychiatry Menninger February 12 1951 (1951), http://archive.org/details/amafilesgiventofdaexhibit9challengefroml.ronhubbardtopsychiatrymenningerfebruary121951.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nate Zaffiro
